title: Face Mesh with ml5.js
description: In this video, I explore the FaceMesh model using ml5.js. I demonstrate how to track all 468 face landmark positions as well as texture map an image onto the triangular mesh with uv coordinates.

timestamps.title: Keypoints and parts of the facemesh.
What is a mesh? Rendering the triangles

codeExamples.title: FaceMesh - Keypoints
codeExamples.description: This sketch demonstrates how to render all of the 468 keypoints detected by the FaceMesh model.

codeExamples.title: FaceMesh - Part
codeExamples.description: This sketch demonstrates how to render the keypoints of a specific part of the FaceMesh model.

codeExamples.title: FaceMesh - Custom List (Lips)
codeExamples.description: This sketch demonstrates how to render the keypoints of custom list of keypoints like the lip contours.

codeExamples.title: FaceMesh - Centered Face
codeExamples.description: This sketch demonstrates how to use the bounding box of the detected face to center the face in the canvas.

codeExamples.title: FaceMesh - Triangles
codeExamples.description: This sketch demonstrates how to render the triangular mesh of the FaceMesh model.

codeExamples.title: FaceMesh - Texture Map
codeExamples.description: This sketch demonstrates how to texture map an image onto the FaceMesh triangles.

codeExamples.title: FaceMesh - 3D
codeExamples.description: This sketch demonstrates how to render the face mesh in 3D.

codeExamples.title: FaceMesh - Blow Bubbles
codeExamples.description: This sketch demonstrates how to emit particles when the mouth is open.

codeExamples.title: FaceMesh - Stretch and Skew
codeExamples.description: This sketch demonstrates how to distort the facemesh triangles with a sine wave.

links.title: The Pixel Array
links.description: This video looks at how to access the pixels of an HTML5 canvas in p5.js.
